title: Beautiful T206 OLD MILL Ty Cobb Green Portrait PSA 3
author: filmmaker

posts.post_title: Beautiful T206 OLD MILL Ty Cobb Green Portrait PSA 3
posts.post_content:
Tough card to find with vivid color, eye appeal and nicely centered.
Message me if you are interested. Serious inquiries please.
I'm sorry as this isn't serious with intent to buy but serious with ENVY :eek::eek::eek::eek::eek::eek::eek:
What is the price?
PM sent !!
How much u asking?

Anyone who uses the BST should stop and say a prayer right now asking that no auction houses or a "dozen" people at cards shows tell the seller this card is worth $25,000 to $35,000.

(Absolute great card, by the way, and one of my favorite front/back combinations. Like others, I'd be interested in buying if you set a price. I have no desire to bid against myself, however, or have my offer used to solicit better ones.)

I posted the card on this site a few days ago, and I have been receiving message after message saying "how much?" 

I am a serious seller looking to sell this card to a serious buyer. Asking "How much?" does not seem to me like a serious buyer, only someone who is just nosey.

I just finished up replying to all of my messages.
The card is absolutely still available.
I wish for it to go to a good home.

Thanks

[quote name="filmmaker" post=1457073]I posted the card on this site a few days ago, and I have been receiving message after message saying "how much?" 

I am a serious seller looking to sell this card to a serious buyer. Asking "How much?" does not seem to me like a serious buyer, only someone who is just nosey.

I just finished up replying to all of my messages.
The card is absolutely still available.
I wish for it to go to a good home.

Thanks[/QUOTE]

it could be argued that without a price listed that the seller may not appear serious....asking how much a card is doesnt really exclude the possibility that the buyer is serious...plus when you dont list a price , you shoudl expect people asking you 'how much'... 

I have noticed that more items sell on B/S/T that have a posted price versus the ones that dont....

(i never did hear back about the price..)

Just got back a reply, he's looking to sell for the "highest price, of course".  Most people want to sell their cards at the lowest price possible so this baffles me.  I told him to set a price or it won't sell.  Fishing should be done on the lakes, not on the BST

I was a serious buyer.  I made an offer.  You're response was:  "You can't be a serious collector."

Your definition of "serious" is someone who will pay an unrealistic price for this card.  You've got to understand.  A lot of collectors here actually know what this card is worth.  We have cards like this already.  

Furthermore, I asked politely for your name while corresponding.  You refused to provide it.  Why?

The problem here is that you have no idea what you're doing.  Figure it out and stop insulting people.

Robert

Seriously.  This is exactly going to be like the Lenox back Cobb thread.  If you want to be taken serious set a serious price.  How much do you need out of the card?  That is not a difficult question.  HOW MUCH DO YOU NEED TO GET FOR THE CARD?  Serious collectors ask that question all the time.  You are wasting everyone's time.

What would be a fair price for this card?
Experts out there educate me as i am not certain of the fair value
